{"analysis":"We need to infer from file name and class summaries. No function summaries given. We have class names: _ExpiringMapping and _IndividualCache. Likely implements a cache with expiration for individual tokens in MSAL (Microsoft Authentication Library). Use heapq for expiration ordering, threading.Lock for thread safety, time for timestamps. So summary: provides an in-memory cache that stores items with TTL, automatically removes expired entries, used by MSAL for token caching per user. Business intent: improve performance and manage token lifetimes, ensure thread-safe access. Keywords: cache, expiration, thread-safe, heap, mapping, token, MSAL, in-memory, TTL, synchronization.   "summary": "Implements a thread‑safe, in‑memory cache that stores items with automatic expiration. An internal mapping tracks entries and a priority queue (heap) orders them by expiry time, allowing efficient removal of stale data.",
  "business_intent": "Provide fast, reliable storage for short‑lived authentication artifacts (e.g., tokens) within the Microsoft Authentication Library, ensuring that expired entries are purged without manual intervention and that concurrent access is safe.",
